buildup.text: Occitan was the language of southern France, spoken from Bordeaux to Nice.

discovery.text: Troubadour poetry in Occitan influenced Dante, Petrarch, and all of European literature.

twist.text: France's centralization policy crushed Occitan â€” children were punished for speaking it in school.

climax.text: Today fewer than 500,000 people speak it fluently. UNESCO lists it as severely endangered.

punchline.text: The language that invented love poetry is dying of neglect.
